RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: [Home page: http://professor.mackenzie.br/pedrob/] Main research topics: computational and dynamical aspects of cellular automata, applications of evolutionary computation, and multi-agent cellular systems. Current chair (triennium 2019-2020-2021) for the second consecutive term, of IFIP WG-1.5: the working group on ''Cellular Automata and Discrete Complex Systems'' of the Technical Committee 1, on ''Foundations of Computer Science'', of the Int. Federation for Information Processing (IFIP). Currently holding research grants from CNPq Bolsa PQ and CAPES STIC-AmSud, and participating in CAPES Mackenzie PrInt. Since 2001: faculty member of the School of Computing and Informatics, Mackenzie Presbyterian University, Sгo Paulo, Brazil, and of its Postgraduate Programme in Electrical Engineering and Computing. From 2016: invited professor in the PhD Programme in Engineering of Complex Systems, Adolfo Ibбсez University, Santiago, Chile. Presently supervises 5 PhD and 1 MSc student, participates in the editorial boards of the Journal of Cellular Automata, Complex Systems, and of the Int. Journal of Natural Computing Research, is a member of the Brazilian Computing Society (SBC) and of the Brazilian Society for Applied and Computational Mathematics (SBMAC), and is actively involved with the AUTOMATA Workshops on Cellular Automata and Discrete Complex Systems. Degree in Electronics Engineering at the Aeronautics Institute of Technology (ITA), Brazil, 1981, MSc in Applied Computing at the Brazilian Institute for Space Research (INPE), 1986; DPhil in Cognitive Science at the University of Sussex, England, 1994; and in 2011-2012 took a sabbatical semester as a visiting researcher at the University of Ottawa, Canada.
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN: Pedro Paulo Balbi de Oliveira received a degree in Electronics Engineering at the Aeronautics Institute of Technology (ITA), Brazil, in 1981, an MSc in Applied Computing, at the Brazilian Institute for Space Research (INPE), in 1986, and a DPhil in Cognitive Science, at the University of Sussex, England, in 1994. In the beginning of his career he worked with knowledge-based artificial intelligence, mostly as a researcher at INPE, but since the early 90s he has been closer to the artificial life and cellular automata communities, doing research on computational and dynamic aspects of cellular automata, and applications of evolutionary computation. Since 2001 he has been a faculty member of the School of Computing and Informatics, at Mackenzie Presbyterian University, in Sгo Paulo, Brazil, in a joint appointment with its Postgraduate Programme in Electrical Engineering. He currently holds research grants from FAPESP (Sгo Paulo State Foundation for Research Support), MackPesquisa (Mackenzie Research Fund) and a Mathematica Academic Grant from Wolfram Research, supervises 2 PhD and 3 MSc students in Electrical Engineering, and 2 undergraduates in Computer Science. He is the organiser of Automata 2009: 15th Int. Workshop on Cellular Automata and Discrete Complex Systems.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
Projeto Individual de Pesquisa do CNPq (No. 300465/95-5), nнvel II-C. Durante 1997 o projeto foi conduzido na Universidade do Vale do Paraнba (UNIVAP), em funзгo de minha mudanзa institucional. 
"The three aims of the research are: 1) To implement a cellular-automata-based computational system, that generalises the one I developed during my doctoral programme; 2) To detail a particular set-up for the system within which it would be possible to approach the issue of emergence of computable functions in an effective way; and 3) To go about probing the emergence process by looking at issues of criticality phenomena that come about during the process."

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Iterative approaches to inverse problems with an emphasis on evolutionary algorithms (funded by FAPESP and British Council)
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
Multi-institutional thematic research project, jointly funded by FAPESP (Thematic Research Grant No. 96/07200-8) and the British Council (Link Grant, Ref. SPA/881/126), mainly comprising the institutions: Inst. de Pesquisa e Desenvolvimento, Univ. do Vale do Paraнba (UNIVAP); Lab. Associado de Computaзгo e Matemбtica Aplicada, Inst. Nacional de Pesquisas Espaciais (INPE); and Centre for Computational Neuroscience and Robotics, University of Sussex, England. Other institutions also participated, but with smaller roles.
The project will follow three research threads linked by the theme of their being related to new computational techniques in the context of inverse problems. Our basic methodology relies on an optimisation framework to iteratively probe the solution space by solving a sequence of direct problems until the optimal alternative is found; such na approach, called iterative, has the advantage of allowing a natural manner to deal with data uncertainty and data redundancy.
The three research threads to be pursued can be characterised as follows: the use of evolutionary computation as a viable and generic problem-solving technique for iterative approaches to inverse problems; the application of classical (non-evolutionary) iterative methods associated with regularisation techniques (mostly entropy-based); and an exploratory thread which aims an evaluation of the possible roles of neural networks in the context of inverse problems. 
Our focus is to follow them in a coordinated fashion, so as to explore their complementarity to solving six real-world inverse problems related to the National Institute for Space Research activities, and/or great economic relevance, selected from the areas of space dynamics, materials science, geophysics, heat transfer, oceanography, and meteorology. With knowledge obtained out of addressing these problems, we may be able to derive a generic methodology that would be important for addressing new inverse problems.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: CEVAL: Computaзгo Evolutiva e Vida Artificial (financiado pelo CNPq)
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
Projeto Temбtico em Ciкncia da Computaзгo do CNPq (ProTem-CC, Edital 04/98), com verba do United Nations Development Program (PNUD-ONU). Os recursos foram obtidos na forma de infraestrutura computacional (1 estaзгo de trabalho, 3 PCs, scanner e impressora laser) para o Grupo de Computaзгo Evolutiva e Vida Artificial da UNIVAP, por mim coordenado.
O programa de pesquisa definido tem seu foco na disciplina de vida artificial; apesar de sua natureza interdisciplinar, й em alguns de seus aspectos computacionais que reside nosso interesse, principalmente a computaзгo evolutiva e, em menor grau, os autфmatos celulares. Tambйm de interesse no projeto sгo sistemas complexos com arquitetura multi-agente do tipo enxame, grosso modo, uma generalizaзгo dos autфmatos celulares, jб que as entidades bбsicas do sistema tкm a capacidade adicional de se mover. A кnfase das atividades do programa nessa linha sгo os estudos de computabilidade, comportamento dinвmico e evoluзгo de autфmatos celulares, e de sistemas correlatos do tipo multi-agente. Enfatiza-se ainda no projeto o tema de computaзгo evolutiva, especialmente sua aplicaзгo na resoluзгo de problemas inversos, isto й, aqueles caracterizados pela busca da causa de um conjunto de efeitos observados. O projeto estб centrado no Grupo de Computaзгo Evolutiva e Vida Artificial da UNIVAP, por mim coordenado, e conta com colaboradores do LAC-INPE, USP, e Universidade de Sussex (Inglaterra), alйm de alunos de pуs-graduaзгo do INPE, ITA e UFSC.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Some cellular automata issues in the NKS approach (funded by Wolfram Research)
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
Mathematica Academic Grant (Ref. 1149), provided by Wolfram Research.
The general motivation of this project is to address some cellular automata related issues, as they bear relevance to the NKS approach. More specificaly, the focus here is the computational ability of cellular automata, and the construction of simple applications with them, either as computing or dynamical systems. Along this line, the main research initiatives being carried out are: 1) To conceive a method for a better characterisation of the limit configurations of some periodic elementary cellular automata, in terms of the regular sets they represent, out of all random initial conditions; 2) To develop search techniques that would lead to one-dimensional cellular automata for solving, as perfectly as possible, the parity problem and the density classification task; 3) To derive analyses techniques of good rules in the previous tasks, that might lead to the best possible rules for the problems, as well as help explain the reasons for their good performance; 4) To evaluate the use of cellular automata as recognisers of simple patterns; and 5) To use cellular automata as dynamical system models. Additional related issues may also be tackled, as long as the advances in the previous topics suggest and/or the availability of human resources allow.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Autфmatos celulares: Estudos teуricos e aplicaзхes (financiado pelo MackPesquisa)
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Os Autфmatos Celulares (ACs) sгo exemplos de sistemas discretos (variбveis, tempo e espaзo) que se tornaram ferramentas importantes no estudo de Sistemas Complexos. A exemplo de outros sistemas desta classe, os ACs exibem um comportamento dinвmico complexo e imprevisнvel. Um aspecto bastante estudado dos Autфmatos Celulares diz respeito a como eles realizam computaзхes. Os ACs computam atravйs de processamentos locais e intrinsecamente paralelos que interagem entre si, emergindo um comportamento global e coordenado. Outro aspecto muito estudado й a previsгo do comportamento dinвmico de um AC a partir de sua definiзгo. Jб foi provado que esta previsгo й um problema indecidнvel e vбrios esquemas aproximados existem na literatura. Em um trabalho recente, um conjunto de parвmetros de previsгo de comportamento dinвmico de Autфmatos Celulares unidimensionais foi selecionado e utilizado para auxiliar a busca evolutiva de Autфmatos Celulares que executam tarefas computacionais especнficas. Tais parвmetros foram utilizados como heurнsticas embutidas na avaliaзгo de um Algoritmo Genйtico utilizado como ferramenta de busca dos ACs. Os resultados encontrados mostraram que os parвmetros selecionados podem efetivamente auxiliar na programaзгo de um AC. Neste projeto, propхe-se dar continuidade a esta linha de pesquisa, atravйs da utilizaзгo de outros modelos de busca e da adaptaзгo do ambiente para ACs bidimensionais. Alйm disso, serгo abordadas aplicaзхes de ACs em criptografia e epidemiologia e serгo estudados aspectos teуricos dos ACs tais como a caracterizaзгo do seu comportamento dinвmico e o relacionamento com equaзхes a derivadas parciais.

FINANCIADOR-DO-PROJETO.NOME-INSTITUICAO: Fundo Mackenzie de Pesquisa
Fundo Mackenzie de Pesquisa

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Advances in computing with cellular automata (funded by MackPesquisa)
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Regardless of more than four decades of cellular automata research, their use for computing functions at large is still at an embryonic stage. The main reason for this failure is the lack of a robust method for designing cellular automata of a predefined behaviour. Interesting cellular automata known in the field, and in virtually any field where they have been applied to, have all been found through stepwise and thought-out engineering, by exhaustive searches in very restricted domains, by formal methods in extremely particular problems, and by specialised search methods, mostly evolutionary, in very specialised problems. Therefore, it is clear that there is the need for some more general and flexible design method, that might be useful across different problems and disciplines. Pursuing this target is the main aim of this project, using two-state cellular automata. The pathway to be followed combines evolutionary computation techniques, with enumerative searches in small regions of the search space, both processes guided by static information drawn from the state transition table of the cellular automata involved. This information gives rise to some parameters already available in the literature, but also to new ones, to be explored herein. In tune of the main target, another is investigating the limit behaviour of one-dimensional cellular automata rules and the outcome of combining their temporal evolutions, as this approach provides another way of performing computation by celular automata means. The project will revolve around a selection of three problems, the density classification task, the recognition of hand-written decimal digits, and the parity problem.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Computing with Cellular Automata and their Temporal or Spatial Compositions (funded by FAPESP and MackPesquisa)
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
Iniciado com financiamentos atravйs de Projeto Regular FAPESP Proc. 2005/04696-3 (concluнdo em 04-2009) e Projeto MackPesquisa Edital 2007 (concluнdo em 01-2009), o projeto prossegue, na mesmo escopo original: "...The pathway to be followed combines evolutionary computation techniques, with enumerative searches in small regions of the search space, both processes guided by static information drawn from the state transition table of the cellular automata involved.
In tune of the latter, three related issues will also be investigated, related to the so-called elementary cellular automata - i.e., one-dimensional, with two states per cell, and such that the transition rule depends only upon the two next-nearest neighbours - namely, the limit behaviour of elementary rules, the outcome of combining their temporal evolutions, and the spatial combination of different rules in the same lattice. 
	All in all, the combined objective of this project is to make advances on the understanding and exploration of the computational ability of cellular automata (either through individual rules, or by their temporal or spatial combinations), as well as the development of effective ways to their design by means of enumerative and evolutionary computation techniques.
The project will revolve primarily around a selection of three problems, the density classification task, the recognition of hand-written decimal digits, and the parity problem, although others may also be considered, as the investigations progress and the research group associated with it develops."
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Computing with Cellular Automata and their Temporal or Spatial Compositions

O Nъcleo й constituнdo pelo Laboratуrio de Interaзхes Sociais e Humanas, e pelo Laboratуrio de Sistemas de Informaзгo e Processamento de Dados e Imagens, este ъltimo mais especificamente relacionado ao subprojeto em questгo. PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Computations at the limit behaviour of cellular automata
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: In spite of their extremely simple structure, cellular automata (CAs) can compute arbitrary functions, by means of a model of computation that is totally parallel, decentralised and, especially, local. The possibility of understanding how they compute and should be designed so as to perform a given computational task would be very relevant for information technology and computing theory. But understanding how these computations are carried out by individual CA rules, rule compositions over time, or spatial arrangement of different rules on the lattice, has been an enduring challenge. Key advances made related to design and analysis of CA rules have opened new perspectives towards understanding how specific CA-based computations are performed. Under the new lights these recent findings have shed, the goal of this project is to step forward, by deepening present understanding of the issues involved in classical computational tasks of the classification type, such as density and parity determination, and to analyse the limit configurations entailed by certain rules, both in terms of their spectral signature and their representation as a formal language. In doing so, we will endeavour to explore the possibility of relating computational and limit behaviour of rules. We have in mind addressing these issues not only in terms of individual CA rules, but also their temporal or spatial combinations.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Computations at the limit behaviour of cellular automata

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Computation and dynamics of deterministic automata networks - CoDANet (funded by CAPES STIC-AmSud 88881.197456/2018-01 and CNPq Bolsa PQ 305199/2019-6)
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
CoDANet is a CAPES funded STIC-AmSud project (no. 88881.197456/2018-01) that links automata theory, discrete dynamical systems and systems engineering, with the objective of deepening current understanding on computational and dynamical aspects of two types of objects, binary cellular automata and Boolean networks. As a methodological requirement, we will rely both on computational and mathematical methods, the former providing empirical data and understanding by means of simulations, and the latter framing the empirical observations into formal settings. In tune with that, we aim at developing mathematical and computational methods related to cellular automata and/or Boolean networks, in order to study their computational abilities and limitations, as well as the global dynamics entailed by the action of their local, deterministic state update functions, be them synchronous or asynchronous. More specifically, we can pinpoint the following:

-- Provide solutions to benchmark computation problems in the literature, under the possible formulations intrinsic to cellular automata and Boolean networks;
-- Better understand the conditions by which the various possible asynchronous updates can be advantageous over the synchronous schedule when performing a generic computation;
-- Analyse properties of the objects under study, with particular relevance to their computational abilities and dynamical behaviour; and
-- Characterise the limit behaviour of specific local functions or sets of them.

Equally important, in addition to the actual research outcomes, the project also aims at strengthening the academic ongoing connections among the partner institutions and fostering new ones, particularly those involving the participating students and young researchers.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Classical and quantum automata networks (part of CAPES PrInt 88887.310281/2018-00)
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
To explore the applicability of cellular automata, especially its quantum version, to the modelling of two-dimensional, graphene-like materials, and to deepen current understanding between properties and computational abilities of automata networks.
This is one of the research tracks within the project "2D materials and nanodevices to be applied to power, telecommunications and sensors", which is one of the four research programmes that make up U.P.Mackenzie's 5-year CAPES funded PrInt research internationalisation initiative, number 88887.310281/2018-00.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Aplicaзхes de algoritmos genйticos e autфmatos celulares (financiado pelo MackPesquisa)
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Algoritmo Genйtico (AG) й uma tйcnica de otimizaзгo estocбstica inspirada no processo evolutivo e na genйtica. Nesta tйcnica, parte-se de uma populaзгo inicial de soluзхes candidatas geradas aleatoriamente que sгo avaliadas de forma a se medir o quгo prуximas elas estгo da soluзгo do problema. Baseado nesta avaliaзгo, um processo de seleзгo separa um sub-conjunto desta populaзгo para servir de base para a geraзгo de uma nova populaзгo de soluзхes candidatas. Esta nova populaзгo й obtida a partir da aplicaзгo de operadores genйticos sobre o sub-conjunto selecionado. Assim, o processo iterage. Ao longo das iteraзхes, a populaзгo evolui atй que se chegue em soluзхes satisfatуrias. Em um projeto Mackpesquisa anterior, denominado Autфmatos Celulares: Estudos Teуricos e Aplicaзхes, a кnfase foi na aplicaзгo dos AGs na busca de regras de transiзгo de autфmatos celulares capazes de executar tarefas especificadas. Autфmatos Celulares (ACs) sгo estruturas computacionais de implementaзгo extremamente simples, que se tornaram importantes ferramentas para o estudo e modelagem de sistemas complexos reais nas mais diversas бreas. Neste projeto, pretende-se dar continuidade a alguns tуpicos relacionados a este problema. Alйm disso, outros tуpicos que derivaram do estudo dos AGs e dos ACs no projeto anterior, como a aplicaзгo dos AGs em Data Mining, serгo explorados.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Coorientaзгo com Nizam Omar.
Os Autфmatos Celulares (ACs) sгo exemplos de sistemas discretos (variбveis, tempo e espaзo) que se tornaram ferramentas importantes no estudo de Sistemas Complexos. A exemplo de outros sistemas desta classe, os ACs exibem um comportamento dinвmico complexo e imprevisнvel. Um aspecto bastante estudado dos Autфmatos Celulares diz respeito a como eles realizam computaзхes. Os ACs computam atravйs de processamentos locais e intrinsecamente paralelos que interagem entre si, emergindo um comportamento global e coordenado. Outro aspecto muito estudado й a previsгo do comportamento dinвmico de um AC a partir de sua definiзгo. Jб foi provado que esta previsгo й um problema indecidнvel e vбrios esquemas aproximados existem na literatura. Neste trabalho, um conjunto de parвmetros de previsгo de comportamento dinвmico de Autфmatos Celulares unidimensionais foi proposto. Como meta para validar a eficбcia destes parвmetros, eles foram utilizados para auxiliar a busca evolutiva de Autфmatos Celulares especнficos que executam determinadas tarefas computacionais. Tais parвmetros foram utilizados como heurнsticas embutidas na avaliaзгo de um Algoritmo Genйtico utilizado como ferramenta de busca dos ACs. Os resultados encontrados mostram que os parвmetros selecionados constituem ferramentas ъteis na previsгo do comportamento dinвmico de Autфmatos Celulares unidimensionais, e podem efetivamente auxiliar na programaзгo de um AC desse tipo para a realizaзгo de uma tarefa computacional especificada.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Coorientaзгo com Guilherme Bittencourt.
O presente trabalho estuda a utilizaзгo de representaзхes espaciais em engenhos de computaзгo evolutiva, como ferramenta para a soluзгo numйrica de problemas inversos. Esta classe de problemas apresenta dificuldades para sua soluзгo pela ausкncia de modelos analнticos, alйm de eventuais degradaзхes introduzidas por ruнdo. Uma das formas tradicionais de resoluзгo de problemas inversos usa mйtodos de otimizaзгo. O presente trabalho o faz utilizando um engenho evolutivo no processo de otimizaзгo. A tese se inicia descrevendo a computaзгo evolutiva e mostrando algumas tйcnicas de otimizaзгo convencional. Nessa descriзгo sгo introduzidos os principais conceitos associados а computaзгo evolutiva em suas vбrias vertentes: estratйgia evolutiva, programaзгo evolutiva e algoritmos genйticos. A seguir sгo apresentados os problemas inversos utilizados para estudo e para o desenvolvimento da metodologia de seu tratamento: condutividade geomagnйtica, transmissгo de calor e de condutividade tйrmica. Seguem-se resultados numйricos obtidos para o primeiro deles, na comparaзгo de uma abordagem clбssica com regularizaзгo versus a otimizaзгo evolutiva. Nesta, sгo tambйm descritos os diversos parвmetros utilizados. Citam-se alguns resultados obtidos para os outros dois problemas. Finalmente, conclui-se afirmando que o mйtodo evolutivo quando aplicado aos problemas inversos aqui estudados, nos quais as soluзхes possuem relaзхes espaciais de vizinhanзa, й eficaz e robusto quanto aos parвmetros, quanto а inicializaзгo e em relaзгo ao ruнdo, tendo uma eficiкncia computacional aceitбvel.
